statement.tex: %text Find the value of $x$ and $y$ if: % 2\left[\begin{array}{cc} 1 & 3 \\ 0 & x \end{array}\right] +\left[\begin{array}{cc} y & 0 \\ 1 & 2 \end{array}\right] =\left[\begin{array}{cc} 5 & 6 \\ 1 & 8 \end{array}\right]

step.context: %text Is this the correct outcome of $2\left[\begin{array}{cc} 1 & 3 \\ 0 & x \end{array}\right]?$ %
step.reason: %text Scalar multiplication of a matrix by $\lambda$, implies each entry of the matrix be multiplied by $\lambda$. % \therefore 2\left[\begin{array}{cc} 1 & 3 \\ 0 & x \end{array}\right] =\left[\begin{array}{cc} 2 & 6 \\ 0 & 2x \end{array}\right]

step.context: %text Is this the correct outcome of % \left[\begin{array}{cc} 2 & 6 \\ 0 & 2x \end{array}\right] +\left[\begin{array}{cc} y & 0 \\ 1 & 2 \end{array}\right]?
step.reason: %text During matrix addition, the corresponding elements of the two matrices are added. Therefore the two matrices being added must have the \underline{\text{same number of rows and}} \underline{\text{columns}}. % \left[\begin{array}{cc} 2 & 6 \\ 0 & 2x \end{array}\right] +\left[\begin{array}{cc} y & 0 \\ 1 & 2 \end{array}\right] =\left[\begin{array}{cc} 2+y & 6 \\ 1 & 2x+2 \end{array}\right]

step.context: \text{If }\left[\begin{array}{cc} 2+y & 6 \\ 1 & 2x+2 \end{array}\right] =\left[\begin{array}{cc} 5 & 6 \\ 1 & 8 \end{array}\right] \\ %text are the following values for $x$ and $y$ correct? %
step.reason: %text If two matrices are equal, their corresponding elements must be equal AND they must have the same number of rows and columns. % \therefore \left[\begin{array}{cc} 2+y & 6 \\ 1 & 2x+2 \end{array}\right] =\left[\begin{array}{cc} 5 & 6 \\ 1 & 8 \end{array}\right] \\ \implies \begin{align} 2+y=5 &\implies y=3 \\ 2x+2=8 &\implies x=3 \end{align}
